creditline: The Katherine Kittredge McMillan Memorial Fund
description: Powder Horn, carved ivory, with original silver fittings; carved images of wild animals; Mughal Dynasty
medium: Ivory with opaque color and silver fittings
text: Ivory gunpowder flasks carved with intertwining animals were popular luxury items in India between 1526 and 1858. Both ends terminate in antelope heads, one showing cheetah chasing a motley crue of rabbits and  antelopes. The body of the flask depicts cheetah pursuing fish, birds, dogs, deer, and rabbits, with small touches of paint highlighting the animals' eyes. Composite animals and scenes of predators pursuing prey were common painting subjects of the time.
title: Powder Flask
